title.native: ラストピリオド －終わりなき螺旋の物語－
title.romaji: Last Period: Owarinaki Rasen no Monogatari
title.english: Last Period: the journey to the end of the despair

description:
The story takes place in a world where fantastic beasts called "Spirals" are born from isolation. Those who can defeat the beasts are called "Periods." Haru is an apprentice Period who belongs to the Arc End 8th Branch. However, after a mysterious theft incident, there is an economic collapse, and the Arc End headquarters abandons the 8th Division, leaving only three Periods left, including Haru. Haru and the other two Periods start their work to rebuild the 8th Division.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Last Period: Perjalanan Menuju Akhir Keputusasaan

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

title.native: メルクストーリア - 無気力少年と瓶の中の少女 -
あんさんぶるスターズ！

node.description:
__Height:__ 173 cm
__Hobbies:__ Karaoke, gaming
__Agency:__ Across Entertainment

[Profile](http://across-ent.com/talent/men/natsuki_hanae.html) | [Website](https://columbia.jp/hanaenatsuki/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hanae0626) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3C3YOGFjn7Pq3lOCeUFHfg) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/hanae0626/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hanae_natsuki0626/)

Won Best Rookie at the 9th Seiyuu Awards (2015) for his role as Inaho Kaizuka in _Aldnoah.Zero_. Won Best Lead Actor at the 14th Seiyuu Awards (2020) for his role as Tanjiro Kamado in _Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba_.

He is married, is a father of twin daughters, and has a cat named [Konpei](https://anilist.co/staff/269430/Konpei).

__Non-Anime Roles:__

- Protagonist - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Ling Yang - Wuthering Waves (VG)

__Height:__ 153 cm
__Agency:__ Racoon Dog

[Profile (Racoon Dog)](https://www.raccoon-dog.co.jp/talent/r09-kitou.html
) | [Official Site](https://kitoakari.com/) | [Twitter (Official)](https://twitter.com/kitoakari_staff/) | [Twitter (Personal)](https://twitter.com/kitoakari_1016/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kitoakari_staff/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCU_E2DHcyQu-Toohyd1vzRw)

A Japanese voice actress. She debuted in 2014, got her first main role in *Time Bokan 24* (2016), and has since received more leading roles. On October 16, 2019, her 25th birthday, she made her debut as a solo music artist under Pony Canyon. After the agency Pro-Fit shut down their operations, she joined the new agency Racoon Dog on 2022. 

**Non anime roles:**
- [Abukuma](https://anilist.co/character/228251/Abukuma), Hass, Isuzu, and Nagara - Azur Lane (VG)
- [Barbara](https://anilist.co/character/203315/Barbara-Pegg) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- [Silence](https://anilist.co/character/186429/Silence) - Arknights (VG)
- Rola - Shadowverse (VG)
- Sabrina - Memento Mori (VG)
- Ashley Graham - Resident Evil 4 Remake (VG)
- Pepper - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- [Celine](https://anilist.co/character/305904 ) - Fire Emblem Engage (VG)

__Hobbies:__ making ribbon bows and sweets, writing poems, Phantasy Star Online

[Website](http://www.tamurayukari.com) | [Profile](http://amuleto.jp/talents/tamura_yukari.html) | [Music Profile](http://www.kingrecords.co.jp/cs/artist/artist.aspx?artist=15412) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/yukari_tamura) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yukari_Tamura) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%94%B0%E6%9D%91%E3%82%86%E3%81%8B%E3%82%8A) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@OfficialChannel-eu5sl)

She is a popular Japanese singer-songwriter and voice actress (seiyuu), currently affiliated with Amuleto (as seiyuu) and with King Records (as songstress). Affectionately called Yukarin by her fans, she is also known for her soft voice and interest in Lolita fashion. She made her debut as a voice actress in 1997, releasing her debut single Yuuki wo Kudasai on March 26, 1997.
While also a well-known seiyuu, several of her releases have been used as opening and ending themes for anime series, while some have reached the Oricon top 100 singles and album charts. Her role as Takamachi Nanoha in the Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha series contributed to a rise in her popularity, as several of her singles (Little Wish: Lyrical Step, Spiritual Garden, Hoshizora no Spica, Beautiful Amulet) were used as the ending themes for the franchise's anime adaptations.

Non-Anime Roles
- Nahida (Genshin Impact) [VG]
- Qiqi (Genshin Impact) [VG]
- Theresa Apocalypse (Honkai Impact 3rd) [VG]
- Vita Clotilde - The Legend of Heroes Series [VG]
- Yvette - Strinova [VG]

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/111209/)._
